sLOdSpaFM65l7S7y7kqX9w.text: Affordable Italian in South Ken, so that's a plus right there!  Pizzas were massive (2 people could definitely share one) and lotsa good combinations of toppings.  Gnocchi was ok. Service was good.

W5Htig3cV3Ypbe7KMagt1Q.text: Great pasta , great seafood and daily fish offerings and Napes style pizza. Very Italian. I have always found the service and staff  excellent. A favorite of mine for 15 years.

_7eu7q4vsW9Tjx1RGasvLA.text: Nice cozy place that serves up great pizza. Pros:Great PizzaAverage to Average + wine listCons:Pasta is on the average sideFor a small place the staff can be forgetful about getting you the wine, water, etc.But definitely a good option for meeting a "romantic interest" at work for a post work casual dinner (read, date).Also good for tourists looking for a low key spot. The pizza definitely hits the spot !!

WPCumkHCyYLGFQER6nnnfw.text: Absolutely fabulous experience! My whole family, a party of twelve, went to eat here after seeing Cirque du Soleil at the Royal Albert Hall to celebrate my Mum's 80th birthday. The staff were wonderful: professional, friendly, attentive. They even put a birthday candle in Mum's dessert:-) The food was outstanding: amazing pizza, great gnocchi and excellent house wine. We ended up staying there from 7pm until almost 11pm! Highly recommended for anyone looking for somewhere to eat close to South Ken tube, just ten minutes walk from the Royal Albert Hall event. Great for large parties as well as solo or couples.

fyormlKnPkYRRN87vYvKyg.text: Lovely little Italian place right near the South Kensington Tube Station. There aren't that many tables so make sure to either get there early or be prepared to wait a bit. The waiters were very nice. I ordered the Fusilli Pierino, it had fresh spinach, crumbled goat cheese, saffron, pine nutes and salted ricotta cheese. It was pretty tasty but kind of rich with all the cheese. It's one of those meals that you can only maybe eat a couple of bites of before it gets a little too much. I definitely recommend sharing so you can get multiple things to try and if the other dishes are as rich as this one...a few bites is just right!

KCMmCMnu-nELxmyXDSPZbw.text: Wettest pizza ever! Our visit to Pierino was hardly a rousing success for a few reasons. The wiseass waiter felt the need to correct our Italian pronunciation, which always annoys me and smirked at us a lot. The pizza prep area is open-plan with clearly no air conditioning as the very sweaty chef would win no food hygiene awards. Not a fan of the food either, we ordered a caprese pizza and while it was huge, it was also sopping with too much tomato and oil. Impossible to eat.  The salads are good with some nice balsamic dressing. Weird toilet situation, just one room with male, female and disabled - frosted glass doors with that ridiculous American inch gap as well. Hello privacy? Despite some trendy outdoor seating, I wouldn't come back here in a hurry.

RzGvfkDJJLprbvsfJeeCwg.text: The pizza was big, big enough to share. Pasta was ok. Initially gave our starter to the wrong table (who rudely ate it when they knew they didn't order a starter) then messed up the main course with a wrong meal (pizza instead of pasta). Also took my plates away while my partner was still eating- pet hate, waiters etiquette101. Won't be visiting this little place again.

mJBd-mEcCw3OcmdoK7kkxQ.text: Took a friend here after a Sunday service at the Brompton Oratory and we were both impressed with our meals. I had a pizza and she had lasagna. Quick service, other than the check which took awhile to get. The take away box for my leftover pizza kinda smushed the pizza but it was a nice atmosphere for a late Sunday lunch. Recommend it! Good food, nice workers, nice location.

veMXNA_s3d2rwB92blkA7g.text: Oh I dream of this place and when I can go to London again just to eat at Pierino's. My flat mate introduced me to this restaurant while I was on study abroad in London for the fall semester in 2006. She's half Italian and Irish and she raved about the food here. Lucky for her, her BF was on a similar program in the South Kensington neighborhood while we were near the British museum and Russell square.Pierino's is a small, family run Italian restaurant. It has the family dinner sort of vibe and the food is awesome! They have good pizza, pesto, risotto, salad, soup, you get my point? While on my program, I took a trip to Rome but I must say the food here was way better than the food I had there, but the gelato in Rome was delish! Anyways back to my review, this is the only restaurant on the street besides a pub and near the tube station there is a Ben's cookies which I also recommend for desert. Definitely mark this place to eat, you won't regret it!

3u_cWKoU37uZG6EopBrFww.text: This place is owned by Italians, so you know it's as good as it gets for the area. It's in a nice location in good old South Kensington. It's not very big but has a very nice atmosphere. The best part is the food. The pizza was light and very delightful and the pasta was amazing! Wish I could come back, but I am now back in the states. :(

MP0ofJtTzhxuSGJ32SeTIA.text: This is a good restaurant! The staff is always happy and super nice. The last time I was there with my family, our waiter gave my girls each a mini panettone. It was during the holidays. Food is normally good, and the atmosphere is always right. The pizza is okay, I've had better just around the corner. But, I go there for the entrees and the smiles. Italians are usually so happy, gotta love them!

hQuZIIsPCeSaL4sDT_Ku1A.text: It used to be easy to find moderately priced Italian restaurants in London, but on this trip we struggled to find them.  We finally found such a place - Pierino!  The staff is all Italian.  Service was playful, but professional and attentive.  And the food is great!  We both started with salads, which were fresh and artfully prepared.  I had the veal Milanese with a side of spaghetti and it was one of the best Milanese I have had in a very long time.  My partner had the carbonara, which was perfectly prepared.  We finished with a slice of white chocolate cake.  The restaurant has a nice wine list and good prices.  All and all a great place!

9Q5xq3qGFK8XO1EURkw4Hg.text: This place was amazing, they had great food, amazing pasta and pizza. Great to bring your kids! They have big sporting events showing on the TV. The waiters there never mess up and are super nice. I went there three nights in a row and loved every time. I highly recommend this place

Eio_em18p3B1Ss3dQ8fhxQ.text: A very nice Italian restaurant owned by an italian family. The Menu proposes a variety of traditional Italian dishes including pasta, lasagne, tagliatelle and pizzas and a good selection of wines. The atmosphere is very friendly!

OKRcLHvwVsdldOT1LWyJiQ.text: Okay spot if you're near by next to the South Kensington station, for me after a haunt at one of the museums close by, this seemed like a nice place to check out.ServiceI felt kind of weird coming here and waited on by their staff. I don't know how to describe it, but it was odd although it was a solid experience.FoodBlack Ravioli with lobster and crab meat. This was off their daily specials. It came with a tangy-spicy thai influenced sauce and grilled cherry tomatoes on the vine. When combining everything on the dish, the bite is quite excellent. Individual elements were good as well, but all together was great. Wish there were more of the cherry tomatoes to go with the ravioli. DessertBefore choosing they have a frig/freezer in the dining area where they bring you to in order to select the dessert of your choice. Basically whatever looks good to you, get it. I grabbed the tiramisu, which was solid dessert, but nothing extraordinary about it.

RAVjI3ugovgptTiUPihKcQ.text: There's nothing special about this place. I got penne ala siciliana and it was alright. Service was kindda slow, we had to call them 3 time to get the bill!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Penne ala siciliana

bPRrQyUiDW-21D-fXzSkWA.text: After a rather annoying struggle to make plans with our friends, I decided to take it upon myself to check Yelp (trusty Yelp!) to make dinner plans for a pre-Christmas get together. As our friends wanted to hang out in their old Imperial College stomping grounds, I quickly chose Pierino.The website for Pierino was not working but I read the reviews and called their number. Eureka! They were able to book us for dinner for eight people and had plenty of vegetarian options to spare...which is a must for a group where all but one diner are vegetarians. If you're at South Kensington station, Pierino is a short walk. Don't arrive too early - if your table isn't ready, there is no where for you to sit. Seeing as it is December and it was coming down with rain, we were annoyed about not being able to be warm and cozy before being seated for our meal. Reservations are a must - Pierino is tiny and popular. BOOK AHEAD, okay? We were seated in a rather cramped section across from the bar, but no matter. The restaurant was crowded and the fact that many of the patrons of the restaurant - as well as the staff - were speaking beautiful, musical Italian gave us good vibes that the meal would be promising. We had a bit of trouble ordering drinks due to the language barrier but our trusty waitress took our drink orders. I had a bellini (needed a bit more of the peach puree, if you ask me) and the rest of our group had lemonades or beers. We ordered starters - a mix of salads, garlic bread and bruschetta. Everything came in hearty portions (be warned, one garlic bread portion is MASSIVE while some of the salads are perfect for just two people). We chose wisely due to the help of our lovely waitress.Ordering mains wasn't difficult as there were so many vegetarian choices but BE WARNED: For some reason, at Pierino, some of the dishes that are vegetarian are NOT (seafood is not vegetarian, my friends) while other dishes are vegetarian and are not marked appropriately. Read everything you're ordering - don't trust the 'V' or lack thereof to order your meal. We selected an array of pastas (the cannelloni was ordered by three of us), pizzas, and one risotto (mine!) and waited for our meal. Pizzas arrived first and some of our friends felt strange eating but food was hot and there was no need to wait. The pastas and risotto took a bit longer but our food arrived soon enough and we dug in. All requests (please add chilis, remove mushrooms) were taken into account beautifully and we all ate our food. Portions are generous so one can eat a pizza to themselves if they'd like or order two between a pair and share. Pastas are quite big, as well.Everything about Pierino was pleasant. A few bumps in the road but the fact that it's in such a convenient location is a plus. I don't know when we'll be back but I'd like to give it another shot!

bk5zDr0jUVF31EbuACDM4w.text: One of my favorite places to dine in London!What can I say, but thank God we found this little Gem!  Located in the South Kensington area of London, this Italian Restaurant is by far the best one in London!The people who work there greet you at the door and completely make you feel at home.  The ambiance is wonderful and you feel like you've stepped into Italy....London is no more in this place!The food is SPECTACULAR!  Every time we have been here we are NOT disappointed at all!  The pizza's are made just like they are made in Italy.  NOT like an American pizza!  American pizzas are so greasy and fattening.....Pierino Pizza's are light and so full of flavor!  So light you can eat one all by yourself!  The pasta and the pasta sauces are very favorable.  You just have to eat the entire dish!  The wine selection is fabulous as well!  The house wine is always great and never disappointing as in some places.  Try the Limon Cello as well for an after dinner aperitif!  So tasty, you'll want more than just one glass!We will always recommend this place to our friends and family who are visiting or who live here!I give this place a 2 thumbs up!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. My son eating a Calazone at Pierino Pizza Pasta Restaurant!

TwYL5qgmttHn9INFando9w.text: The food was very nice, but I ordered a pasta and the portion was much too small. If it had been advertised as an entree, that's perhaps to be expected, but a main course shouldn't leave you hungry.

kSd4EIZktmQNM1ZFzbfUBQ.text: Love this place! It is always busy and run by authentic Italians...a majority of the staff is always speaking Italian. They have a nice wine selection, scrumptious pizzas, and wonderful pasta dishes (I especially recommend any of their baked pasta dishes). This is one of those places that you want to go with friends and just spend the evening sipping down a bottle of wine.

1Yib8aNXehHPtZWbbZsvsw.text: Awesome Hawaiian Pizzas one is big enough for two people. We are here two days in a row.

GV_cMGrsfC4V5LaB7FiUbA.text: Based on other Yelp reviews we gave this place a try. Fried calamari and shrimp was basic and bland, and caprese pizza with sun dried tomatoes was just OK. Crust was good but toppings were spare and unimaginative. Wines were good, however. Space is cozy if cramped. Service was inattentive and absent minded. Our server had to ask us again what we had when he went to calculate the bill because he never wrote any of it down. Service charge was added in for party of 2 and I would have made it lower if I could. Disappointing given the other reviews on here and the surrounding area.

fUcDBjzVTya8q-v6nXP0Jw.text: I stumbled upon this little gem after an afternoon at the nearby museums and I'm glad I did. Pierino's is a tiny little family run Italian restaurant. The Pizzas are hand made and enough for one hungry person. I had the Luganica, which was basically a spicy sausage pizza and it was damn good. The staff here were helpful and patient with my mangling of the Italian language. The food is great and reasonably priced. We returned for dinner later in the week. A pizza with many instruction for the lady and lobster fettuccine for me. My wife loved her pizza and my pasta had half a lobster in it and was delicious. Our banana cake dessert was tasty. Dining room is a bit tight, but you are here to eat right? You are probably going to be right around here for the museums. So, keep this place in mind.

bO8KRLOaJj1jotAq8VGbAg.text: It could have been an off night, but for starters the service was very poor.  We arrived at about 8:30 on a Monday night and the restaurant was very full as it was a nice evening. Let's start with the service.  We decided to sit outside after the host indicated the table was available.  We ended up waiting quite awhile before anyone came over to ask us what we would like to drink or order.  After ordering, we saw the waitress bring over our pastas before the appetizer, realizing she had forgotten our salad and go back into the kitchen....needless to say they did not re-prepare our main dishes.Now onto the food, my friend and I ordered a tricolore salad with mozzarella and avocado to share.  I was disappointed to find the mozzarella was not fresh or flavorful, it appeared to have been purchased at a supermarket.  For my main I had a pasta with a light tomato cream sauce, spring onion, peas and bacon.  The sauce on the pasta lacked any flavor.  However, my companion did like her pasta which had fresh vegetables and chicken.  Overall, I was unimpressed.  There are far too many great Italian restaurants in South Kensington if you venture a bit away from the tube station to spend your money here.

3pt6iZj5Op0sEp8LCBuy7g.text: I fully support the other five star reviews.  Great food and wonderful staff. We booked for 5, two adults and three kids. We showed up a little late for our booking, but the table was still set for us. We were all jet lagged, our youngest so much so she put her head on the table and went to sleep. Our server was in great spirits and happy to feed a family of tired Americans. I had a wonderful salad that combined a traditional caprese with a side salad of grilled artichoke and sun dried tomatoes. A wonderful riot of flavours and colors. Our pizzas were wonderful. Among the best crust I have had, generous sized and perfectly cooked. The cheerful service and good food helped provide badly needed new energy to the family members going on to see The Hunger Games.The atmosphere was sophisticated but not stuffy.  The price was very fair for the quality of the food and service.

BQ8g2rQvMibqm3Z2m9VG_Q.text: The staff and service was outstanding.  My boys destroyed their pasta dishes including spaghetti and pasta verogonle (clams).  My wife had some chicken and forced some tomato alla caprese on me.  The alla caprese was not on the menu but they whipped it up anyway.   Enjoyed the family atmosphere and great service but since my boys did not share their food with me I cannot rate them higher.   They do have an excellent wine selection and recommended a great red to my wife.   Meanwhile I enjoyed another Peroni.

-u35kVtYFCyo_5xaE3lXQQ.text: Stopped in for lunch after finding it on the trusty Yelp App. Menu offered a good choice. I was torn between the pizza which looked awesome and the cannelloni. I chose the cannelloni in the end, which was very dry compared to other restaurants I've had it in (definitely would benefit from more sauce). Staff were friendly enough and were around quite frequently. Our experience here added to a lovely afternoon out in South Ken.

lhMYYgX-LrCldljtPyR0YA.text: Had dinner on Friday with party of 6, absolutely fabulous service and food was so great. I wanted to go back the next day but my friends thought i should experience more variety in London. I still think you shouldn't mess with perfection.  Go. You will not regret it.

a4Kb27z9jPV0NQOxwVMNOA.text: We had the La Pizza Kiss pizza and vegetarian cannelloni and they were both good.  The cannelloni could use a little more flavor and was better on the half that had the tomato sauce.  The pizza was great, mainly due to flavor from the Gorgonzola.  We also had a mixed salad which was average, and the 1/2 bottle of chianti which was pretty good.  The service was not bad and could have been a bit more attentive.We'll be back to try the other veggie options.

UpUCZxfeGmaX91fMFh8jdQ.text: Great meal, great service and great price (did I mention great location?)!!!  Seriously... This was perfect, as is now on our London dining list. Had pasta and pizza, and all very yummy. Basic but good wine list. One of those places that is a safe bet for a night you just don't want to risk it, or want to impress family or friends. Seating outside if it's nice enough out.

qx4-pPnZWv2DyWS52Hm2ZA.text: Delightful Italian place, ideal pre/post-museum trip in South Ken. I took my date here for lunch before heading to the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibit. She had the risotto and I had a ham and mushroom pizza. We were both very happy with the food, tasty and fresh-tasting food.The staff were very friendly, but I've knocked off one star as I booked in advance but we still had to wait for a table, it felt like they just waited until someone was done to seat us.

wojK9HYyzPxzpwMn34OWpw.text: Really bad food. Took 5 minutes to make a risotto. It doesn't take 5 minutes to make risotto. It was rice with sauce. The Penne was pathetic. I'm a student and I make budget penne at home that tastes 100 times better.

oPaJYhl2kJNX9bPgaWgcGQ.text: This was a delicious pizza for a decent price!  Like a before reviewer said, the pizza is very wet and does need some utensil use at first, but that is not really a major issue since the taste is good.  The restaurant was reasonably full the whole time we were there, and that is saying something considering so many restaurants have empty seats regularly during the week.  It was strange that they assumed I was tipping 2.50 pounds for my 7.50 pizza when I paid with a 10.  I would have gladly given a tip for the service and pizza, but was a bit disappointed they did not provide me the opportunity to do so.

06WBQiGsCXtZcUIpc99GsQ.text: A modestly priced Italian in the heart of tourist land, a short dash from the Science Museum and the Natural History Museum, where multi-coloured foreign exchange students line the streets and bump into everyone they possibly can :-) Enough of the gripes, I was actually enticed in here by an American tourist licking her lips exclaiming 'this pizza tastes like it does back home!' That was incentive enough for me, as I ordered a thin yet moist quattro stagioni rounded off by an ornately presented salad, that looked a little like an edible palace. Chomp, chomp I went before wolfing down a tiramisu and a complimentary shot of limoncello to round off a rather lovely evening. Better than most tourist traps in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom

6rIUOSKSbKvVKP2yLz0r3g.text: Pizza is the  best, I love their pizza！ It is tsaty and is not too thick. Highly recommended. For clam pasta, it  is also delicious. The staffs are friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom

cLBWh3efTGxHFitEWlyQuw.text: Wow,  I can't believe this place only has 3.5 stars.  I have been going here for 25 years,  through various owners starting with an old Italian gentleman... It has nothing but impressed me over the years.  The lasagna is awesome,  pizza diavola is also amazing,  the crust is think and it very,  very tasty.  I haven't had the minestrone soup lately but I used to be great.  The garlic bread,  think that's what it's called,  is thin crust pizza with tomato sauce and herbs.Really I doubt you can have a bad meal here. The service is great and really nice vibe...

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna is very decadent and delicious,  lots of bechamel sauce..
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Awesome diavola pizza.  So tasty!

weeMzbUA2gjEbmpC2OypMA.text: Pasta fresh from the box.  Even the pizza, which is clearly made on site, had the dreaded soggy bottom.  The bonus was the waiter, who seemed determined not to serve the food actually ordered.  Perhaps he was trying to tell me something.  I wish I had listened.

kwvtgezs6eXu067GveZP1A.text: Whilst down in London with my sister, we were visiting the National History Museum and got hungry so looked for somewhere nearby to eat late lunch at. We happened upon Pierino which is located opposite the museum and checked out ratings for the place; it seemed to be alright so after a short queue, we were then seated.I get the feeling this place is always busy, being ideally located from the museum. The interior is clean with simple wooden tables and they've tried to stuff as many tables and chairs into this tiny space as possible. However, there is no table-sharing, so that was pleasant. We ended up having a 4 seater to ourselves due to the positioning of the tables near the bathroom. The placemats are simple laminate cards, which is cheap but effective due to the high turnover of customers this place no doubt gets.It did take a while to get the attention of someone, being sat quite away from the main part of the restaurant. The menu is varied, though, so there is sure to be something that suits all palettes. The specials are on a menu located to the right of the restaurant as you enter. There is, unfortunately, no printed version of this menu, so I'm afraid you'll just need to glance at it as you're waiting to be seated, or take a photo.It was a warm day when we visited, so we both ordered some San Pellegrino lemonade. These came in the bottles along with some glasses with ice in them. It took a while for the waiter to come back after we ordered our drinks. Once the order was placed, we waited a while before our food arrived. This was due to the huge number of customers. I was in no rush, but I imagine if you were, this place is probably not ideal.Pappardelle with duck ragu and crumbled amarettiI ordered the pappardelle with duck ragu from the specials menu and it was gorgeous! The crumbled amaretti added that hint of sweetness to the dish, the pasta was cooked al dente and there was plenty of ragu and duck. The pasta side of things was quite small, though, so maybe not for someone who's really hungry. The herb parsley on top was unnecessary.Gnocchi Luganese: Home made potato dumplings with fresh luganica sausage, white wine mushrooms, chilli and fresh tomatoesMy sister liked her gnocchi but felt the portion was small and the parsley here again was unnecessary. I might visit again if we were hungry after coming out from the National History Museum but I wouldn't make a deliberate trip to visit this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Gnocchi Luganese: Home made potato dumplings with fresh luganica sausage, white wine mushrooms, chilli and fresh tomatoes
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Pappardelle with duck ragu and crumbled amaretti
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Pierino interior

FrOhfKEdSF6K3iSuHXRg4w.text: The food was ok. Watery risotto and lackluster pizza. Service was bad. Incredibly slow.A definite pass.

eA-tP22yBd_hxyJkI3RTJQ.text: Wow, this place was good. We were excited the moment we came through the door and the garlicky goodness hit us in the face. Fresh ingredients, great service, awesome recipes/flavours, I can't really ask for more! This is just a 5 minute walk from the South Kensington tube station, very convenient. If you're a tourist and looking for a good Italian place or pizza, this is it. I really regret not ordering the garlic bread as a starter because it looked AMAZING.

0XGOwLXx-6I9TvobefRRCQ.text: I have been to Pierinos about 5 or 6 times & it's always great . The sitting area is small but cozy , I like the outside dinning. The service is always very good ! The servers are always very personable. The  price is good for what you get. The  quality is very good. I have always been very happy with everything I have ordered. The pizza , the salmon  pappardelle is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom

wFBLEVBM42m9y86sLWP5Jg.text: First time here and wanted to try the pizza. This was just as good as going to Italy! Had the pizza. napoletana and the flavor and crist were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom

YCzkPq_LePWgugUJVMA_QA.text: Was there on Easter Day around 4pm for lunch. Had a pizza margherita with basil and buffalo mozzarella for £8.20, not too bad as a price given the location.The venue looks nice, only once seated you realise it's too tiny to host so many seats. Staff is not 100% Italian, and not 100% nice. Pizza itself was nice. Roman style, thus thin and crispy rather than thick like Naples style. Tomato sauce was okay, buffalo mozzarella as well and fresh basil on top (on my request). I had the impression they used soya flour for the dough and asked clarification to the waiter, who went like: "Are you allergic?" As I answered no he said they use normal plain flour. How can I put it, dubious?I liked the pizza overall, but will not be back, as I didn't like the service. They also serve more expensive dishes such as pasta fish or meat by the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Margherita with buffalo mozzarella and extra basil for 8.20

HuiVUt4QuCqaQcEZcTvUoA.text: Service is excellent! I ordered the wrong pizza in the beginning and they exchanged it right away.  They even gave our kid a nice ice cream cup for free in the end! Food taste great too and rightly priced. Would definitely come back to visit if we are in London again!

0OnBisRK3dghjQEogK84_A.text: I eat here every time I am in London. The food is always delicious and the service is great. But what I saw tonight went so above and beyond. At the table next to me, a man accidentally spilled the woman across from him's wine into her dinner. She was so upset.  Immediately the manager came over and took the wine glass and the dinner with the spilled wine in it away and replaced it with a new glass of wine and a new dinner. The fact that he was so on top of everything and replaced her meal and her wine was amazing. The woman was very upset with the man that spilled the  wine, but the fact that the manager replaced everything alleviated any tension at the table and made everything OK. This is a perfect example of customer service. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. Excellent food and and  excellent service.

oOxB_q82gbQPWzZjZjhA_Q.text: Wandered in after a long day and had an outstanding meal. They went out of their way to make our tired children happy, the food was fantastic, the wine was delicious and the service was amazing. Could not recommend this place more, 5 stars.

RkreXOPHshwnZ4VdFU_cgA.text: Great food, excellent wine list. Good service and presentation. I had pizza. Friend had veal. Both were delicious. Dessert was amazing. The mango creme brûlée was to die for!Definitely a hidden gem in London. Plan on visiting again next time I'm in town.

E7EuPCZ7vwMyQkRnP-IdVQ.text: It's small inside but we were quite early so managed to get out pick of tables. Before our food had even arrived though the place was full and buzzing with people so if you have your heart set on eating here I would suggest that you book a table in advance.I don't usually have pasta when I'm out as to me that's a super quick dish that I cook at home when I'm short on time not something that I want to pay a lot of money for but the Pappardelle Machiavelli got me with two things - 1. They called the pasta princess pasta (yes, I'm a child) and 2. It came with smoked salmon which is one of my favourite things in the whole world.Given how busy the place was and that everything is cooked right there at the front of the store (there doesn't appear to be a separate kitchen) the food came out really quickly. The portion looked quite small when it arrived but it was actually really filling and from the first bite I was hooked. It was so creamy and delicious and the amount of smoked salmon was fairly generous. The only place I have ever had better pasta was Tentazioni. The staff were nice and not overbearing although it did take us a while to get the bill when it was time to leave. Prices are reasonable especially for its location and I'd definitely recommend it for families who are in the area to check out the museums.

zM2fR4avb4764Bym8aY4RQ.text: A lovely and charming restaurant for an easygoing meal. The staff are so welcoming and the ambiance is so nice, it's hard to leave! The Gnocchi is amazing, and there are also rotating specials. The wine selection is also very good, which was a pleasant surprise as this restaurant is very understated. If you are in the mood for a relaxing evening with good food and wine, I would definitely recommend this establishment.

VbOm4lq3AmAcdVNwvfEimA.text: This place makes me so ANGRY! like I want to punch a kitten angry. Italian food is arguably "easy", in that the cuisine relies on good, fresh, clean ingredients and for fuck's sake, how do you serve overcooked, oversauced, overseasoned PASTA? It only takes the mental capacity of a fucktard to make pasta, so for an actual establishment -in South Kensington no less- to mess this up... i mean come on. And the pizzas? Lord help me with the pizza. The salad too... I had a caprese and the mozzarella was chewing gum imported from Chernobyl. I am NOT a fan.

z6lOnc0wl3vQs2ud_EJ2gg.text: Bruschetta, Risotto with prawns and veal were all delicious. Kids loved their pizza. Wine selection was great

68dqEmBqhnnUbdnOTDnDDw.text: My family enjoyed this pleasant, little Italian place in South Kensington. We all tried different types of pasta, everything was good. The portions were fairly large, especially for the fair price.  We just had the house red wine with dinner, which was not anything great, but they offer other wine options.My only real complaint was that we had ordered salads to start and were given no time between the salad and and the main meal being brought tot he table. The salad was very good (mostly because of the creamy dressing that was on it). While I appreciate that it did not take long for our meal to come, I think they should give the dinners some time with the starter first.We were seated inside as it was rainy the day we came (what, raining in London?!). They have a small outside area with tables (and heat lamps) that would be nice to sit outside and people watch.

caXDfTeZ2pOx-gdldHWHUg.text: Pros: Excellent food, good drinks list, and very reasonable prices (especially for the area).Cons: It was pretty tiny inside, which meant we were rammed right up against other tables. This is fine if the other people you're eating near are okay, but it's not great when you end up next to a really noisy table with terrible manners (there was some serious staring happening and it was very off-putting). It was also really noisy, and the front door didn't shut properly, so we got a burst of cold air from outdoors every five minutes.If I were rating just on the food, it would get 4+ stars because the food was delicious and came quickly. But the slow service and terrible atmosphere has dinged it down a lot.

dLEjW9haJGwTUVD9IqFyaw.text: I had a very pleasant lunch at Pierino following a visit to the Victoria and Albert Museum. Upon entering the establishment, I was blown away by the simplistic yet chic decor at Pierino. It's very clean yet still inviting, which I liked. I ordered a pasta dish with mushrooms and cheese which was beyond incredible--the cheese was fresh and the pasta tasted homemade. Most of the wait staff appeared to be Italian so I guess that explains the delectable food here! It's truly authentic and delicious. The restaurant was very quiet when I was there which was an added bonus, plus most of the items on the menu were fairly priced. I'll be back next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierino Pizza Pasta - London, United Kingdom. Extremely yummy!
